verses.kjv: And Samson went down to Timnath, and saw a woman in Timnath of the daughters of the Philistines.
verses.ct: Samson traveled down to Timnath, where he noticed a young Philistine woman.

verses.kjv: And he came up, and told his father and his mother, and said, I have seen a woman in Timnath of the daughters of the Philistines: now therefore get her for me to wife.
verses.ct: When he returned home, he told his father and mother, "I noticed a Philistine woman in Timnath. Arrange the marriage for me."

verses.kjv: Then his father and his mother said unto him, Is there never a woman among the daughters of thy brethren, or among all my people, that thou goest to take a wife of the uncircumcised Philistines? And Samson said unto his father, Get her for me; for she pleaseth me well.
verses.ct: His father and mother responded, "Isn't there a single woman among your own relatives or anywhere among our people? Why do you have to marry an uncircumcised Philistine?" But Samson told his father, "Arrange it for me — she's the one I want."

verses.kjv: But his father and his mother knew not that it was of the LORD, that he sought an occasion against the Philistines: for at that time the Philistines had dominion over Israel.
verses.ct: His parents didn't realize that this was part of the LORD's plan, because he was looking for an opportunity to confront the Philistines. At that time, the Philistines were ruling over Israel.

verses.kjv: Then went Samson down, and his father and his mother, to Timnath, and came to the vineyards of Timnath: and, behold, a young lion roared against him.
verses.ct: So Samson went down to Timnath with his father and mother. When they reached the vineyards near Timnath, suddenly a young lion came charging at him, roaring.

verses.kjv: And the Spirit of the LORD came mightily upon him, and he rent him as he would have rent a kid, and he had nothing in his hand: but he told not his father or his mother what he had done.
verses.ct: The Spirit of the LORD rushed over him with power, and he ripped the lion apart with his bare hands as easily as tearing apart a young goat — and he had no weapon at all. But he didn't tell his father or mother what he had done.

verses.kjv: And he went down, and talked with the woman; and she pleased Samson well.
verses.ct: He went on down and spoke with the woman, and she really appealed to him.

verses.kjv: And after a time he returned to take her, and he turned aside to see the carcase of the lion: and, behold, there was a swarm of bees and honey in the carcase of the lion.
verses.ct: Some time later, he went back to marry her. Along the way, he stepped off the road to look at the lion's carcass, and there inside it was a swarm of bees with honey.

verses.kjv: And he took thereof in his hands, and went on eating, and came to his father and mother, and he gave them, and they did eat: but he told not them that he had taken the honey out of the carcase of the lion.
verses.ct: He scooped some honey out with his hands and ate it as he walked. When he reached his parents, he shared some with them and they ate it too. But he never mentioned that he had taken the honey from the dead lion's body.

verses.kjv: So his father went down unto the woman: and Samson made there a feast; for so used the young men to do.
verses.ct: His father went down to meet the woman, and Samson hosted a feast there, since that was the custom for young men getting married.

verses.kjv: And it came to pass, when they saw him, that they brought thirty companions to be with him.
verses.ct: When the Philistines met him, they provided 30 young men to serve as his groomsmen.

verses.kjv: And Samson said unto them, I will now put forth a riddle unto you: if ye can certainly declare it me within the seven days of the feast, and find it out, then I will give you thirty sheets and thirty change of garments:
verses.ct: Samson said to them, "Let me pose a riddle to you. If you can solve it during the 7 days of the feast, I'll give you 30 linen garments and 30 sets of clothing."

verses.kjv: But if ye cannot declare it me, then shall ye give me thirty sheets and thirty change of garments. And they said unto him, Put forth thy riddle, that we may hear it.
verses.ct: "But if you can't solve it, then you give me 30 linen garments and 30 sets of clothing." They replied, "Go ahead — let's hear your riddle."

verses.kjv: And he said unto them, Out of the eater came forth meat, and out of the strong came forth sweetness. And they could not in three days expound the riddle.
verses.ct: He said to them, "From the eater came something to eat; from the strong came something sweet." For 3 days they couldn't figure out the answer.

verses.kjv: And it came to pass on the seventh day, that they said unto Samson’s wife, Entice thy husband, that he may declare unto us the riddle, lest we burn thee and thy father’s house with fire: have ye called us to take that we have? is it not so?
verses.ct: On the seventh day, they approached Samson's wife and said, "Persuade your husband to reveal the answer to us, or we'll burn you and your father's household alive. Did you invite us here just to rob us?"

verses.kjv: And Samson’s wife wept before him, and said, Thou dost but hate me, and lovest me not: thou hast put forth a riddle unto the children of my people, and hast not told it me. And he said unto her, Behold, I have not told it my father nor my mother, and shall I tell it thee?
verses.ct: So Samson's wife went to him crying and said, "You must hate me! You don't really love me at all! You gave my people a riddle and you won't even tell me the answer." He replied, "Look, I haven't even told my own father and mother — why would I tell you?"

verses.kjv: And she wept before him the seven days, while their feast lasted: and it came to pass on the seventh day, that he told her, because she lay sore upon him: and she told the riddle to the children of her people.
verses.ct: She cried in front of him through all 7 days of the feast. Finally, on the seventh day, he gave in and told her because she pressured him so relentlessly. She then passed the answer along to her people.

verses.kjv: And the men of the city said unto him on the seventh day before the sun went down, What is sweeter than honey? And what is stronger than a lion? And he said unto them, If ye had not plowed with my heifer, ye had not found out my riddle.
verses.ct: On the seventh day, just before sunset, the men of the city came to him and said, "What is sweeter than honey? What is stronger than a lion?" Samson replied, "If you hadn't used my wife to get the answer, you never would have solved my riddle."

verses.kjv: And the Spirit of the LORD came upon him, and he went down to Ashkelon, and slew thirty men of them, and took their spoil, and gave change of garments unto them which expounded the riddle. And his anger was kindled, and he went up to his father’s house.
verses.ct: Then the Spirit of the LORD rushed over him. He went down to Ashkelon, killed 30 of their men, stripped them of their belongings, and gave the sets of clothing to those who had solved the riddle. Burning with anger, he went back to his father's house.

verses.kjv: But Samson’s wife was given to his companion, whom he had used as his friend.
verses.ct: Meanwhile, Samson's wife was given in marriage to the groomsman who had been his best man.
